alert.note: Alert for Blount; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 8:53PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount, Knox and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 952 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain and minor flooding in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Sevierville, Alcoa, Farragut, Louisville, Rockford, Lake Forest, Bearden, Maloneyville, Seymour, Kimberlin Heights, Karns, Mascot and House Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
